title: XPCOM error
content: Hello, after a recent update, I keep getting this error when trying to open Thunderbird: "couldn't load XPCOM. How can I fix this error? Thank you.
creator: cslalonde7

title: Deciphering a group email
content: I received an email where I am part of a "grouped email" that the sender created. How do I expand the group email to see the other email addresses included in the group?
creator: yankj49

title: Scam or junk emails
content: I receive lots of junk or scam emails. I don't open them in order to make sure nothing negative happens. I'm constantly close to running out of storage space due to all these daily emails. My question is: is there a way to safely block or unsubscribe from these emails without clicking on them (opening them)? I right click on them in Thunderbird but don't see a suitable option. Also, I haven't ever deleted my junk folder, and I know there are emails in there that I need, so I can't periodically delete the junk folder (at least not for foreseeable future). I'd be very appreciative of any help! Thanks in advance.
creator: frende3

title: There are NO e-mails after changing 'Password' and kept asking 'password' over, over again
content: Hello: There are four(4) different e-mail accounts on my Thunderbird and asking 'New Password' in the rectangular box popping up. I changed one of my passwords(main account) by accessing my provider(Xfinity). However, when I attempted to access my e-mail. there is no e-mails and kept asking 'Password' which I typed a rectangular box popping up in the middle of the screen. Also, there is NO Thunderbird when opening-up Thunderbird. Just 'octopus' figure I can see. How to access my e-mail(one of my accounts...main account)? Thanks a help in advance.
creator: aelmo

title: There is NO my e-mail account on the left-side of pane on Thunderbird
content: Hello: There is no account on Thunderbird after password glich. title: How to sort mail in the order of decreasing size?
content:
Thunderbird (Windows) shows option to sort mail by size, but it is greyed out so unable to sort this way. PFA image.

Can anyone explain how to make this work?

Thunderbird Info: Version 115.12.2 (64-bit)

Mail Server Info: (Gmail) Server Type: IMAP Mail Server Server Name: imap.gmail.com | Port: 993 Outgoing Server (SMTP): Google Mail - smtp.gmail.com (Default)

Synchoronisation and Storage settings: attached as image.

OS Info: Edition Windows 10 Home Single Language Version 22H2 Installed on ‎24-‎02-‎2021 OS build 19045.4651 Experience Windows Feature Experience Pack 1000.19060.1000.0


P.S. the purpose is to delete messages occupying the mailbox unnecessarily by going through them in the order of decreasing size. If there is another way to do this, that should also be fine.
creator: vvishalchandrahaas

title: Intermittent emails downloading to desktop
content:
Hi

I've been using Thunderbird for years with no issues. It's set up using IMAP and downloads emails from the web from my ISP. I have several different email account with my ISP. They are all set up to download to Thunderbird. All but one is working fine.

My primary email, however, is only downloading intermittently. It downloads all my emails on start up, then doesn't download any more unless I close Thunderbird and re-open. This is a new issue. Nothing has changed in my set up which is configured identically for all my email address (and the others are working fine).
creator: BAMimages

title: Problem with SMTP server GMAIL, also after re-insytalling Thunderbird
content:
I can not send emails anymore from my gmail account. SMTP authentication faild. Tried to reset password, did not succees (it succeeded on my mobile phone and in the browser). Updated Thunderbird (see image), however nothing seems to work :-(

IMAP does work, so fortunatly I can receive answers to solve this problem !

Does anyone has a tip ??

title: Problem Importing addresses from a CSV
content:
I have a CSV file from Outlook with addresses I want to import into Thunderbird.

In an older version of Thunderbird I was able to match the fields in the CSV to the fields in the Thunderbird address book but in the latest version this seems to be missing - I was able to move the fields up/down to match before importing but this doesn't seem to be available (see attached screen shot). The import screen looks different with no way of moving fields up/down to match.

The drop down arrows on the fields on the right (the Thunderbird address fields) only show one field so I am not able to match them.

How do I match the fields to the CSV file so I can import my addresses/contacts.

Thanks
creator: davidswoods60
